com.jgefroh.core
Interface IEntity

All Known Implementing Classes:
Entity
public interface IEntity

The interface for an Entity.

An Entity is merely a container for Components that describe the same element.

Since:
0.1.0
Version:
0.3.0
Author:
Joseph Gefroh
See Also:
IComponent

Method Summary
 void add(IComponent component)
          Adds the given Component to this Entity.

Method Detail

addComponent

void addComponent(IComponent component)
Adds a Component to this Entity.

Parameters:
component - the instance of the component to add

add

void add(IComponent component)
Adds the given Component to this Entity.

Parameters:
component - the instance of the component to add

getComponent

<T extends IComponent> T getComponent(java.lang.Class<T> type)
Gets the Component of the passed type from this Entity.

Parameters:
type - the Class type of the component to retrieve
Returns:
the component of the passed type saved in this Entity; null if the component does not exist

removeComponent

<T> void removeComponent(java.lang.Class<T> type)
Removes the Component of the passed type from this Entity, if it exists.

This method should flag this Entity as having been changed.

Parameters:
type - the Class type of the component to remove

setChanged

void setChanged(boolean hasChanged)
Sets the flag that indicates whether this Entity's Component composition has changed.

Parameters:
hasChanged - true if there was a change; false otherwise

hasChanged

boolean hasChanged()
Checks the flag that indicates whether this Entity's Component composition has changed.

Returns:
true if there was a change; false otherwise

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Gets the human-readable name of this Entity.

The name should not be used to uniquely identify this Entity. It is purely for legibility.

Returns:
the name of this Entity, if it was given one

setName

void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the human-readable name of this Entity.

The name should not be used to uniquely identify this Entity. It is purely for legibility.

Parameters:
name - the name of this Entity, if it was given one

getID

java.lang.String getID()
Sets the unique ID of this Entity.

The ID should not be used by any other object.

Returns:
the unique ID of this Entity

setID

void setID(java.lang.String id)
Gets the unique ID of this Entity.

Parameters:
id - the unique ID of this Entity
